title: Effect of catalyst on activation energy

content.question: The energy distribution profile (Curve C) for the <math alttext=" Y 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules is shown in the graph above for the reaction <math alttext="X plus Y 2 react to produce X Y 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>X</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>â†’</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>XY</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> when it is done under certain experimental conditions. Line A represents the most probable energy of the <math alttext=" Y 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules, and Line B represents the activation energy. Which of the following changes should be made to the graph to explain the increase in the rate of the reaction if the only change in experimental conditions is the addition of a catalyst?

choices.label: Curve C will broaden and Line B will move to the left, because more <math alttext=" Y 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules will have an energy greater than the minimum energy needed to overcome the activation energy barrier.

Line B will move to the left because a larger fraction of the <math alttext=" Y 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules will have the minimum energy to overcome the activation energy barrier.

Curve C and Line A will move to the right because the average energy of the <math alttext=" Y 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules will increase.

Line A will move to the right because the most probable energy of the <math alttext=" Y 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules will increase.

content.answer: Line B will move to the left because a larger fraction of the <math alttext=" Y 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules will have the minimum energy to overcome the activation energy barrier.

skill.text: 6.E: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using connections between particulate and macroscopic scales or levels.
